intro: Astragalus wrangelii, commonly known as Wrangel's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions of Eurasia. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish to reddish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Its leaves are compound, with small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Astragalus wrangelii plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats and is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptations to extreme climates.
